trans-unit.source: Consider the following guidelines when accessing Azure storage services using the storage client API:
trans-unit.target: Consider the following guidelines when accessing Azure storage services using the storage client API:

trans-unit.source: Use the built-in retry policies from the Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.RetryPolicies namespace where they are appropriate for your requirements.
trans-unit.target: Use the built-in retry policies from the Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.RetryPolicies namespace where they are appropriate for your requirements.

trans-unit.source: In most cases, these policies will be sufficient.
trans-unit.target: In most cases, these policies will be sufficient.

trans-unit.source: Use the ExponentialRetry policy in batch operations, background tasks, or non-interactive scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Use the ExponentialRetry policy in batch operations, background tasks, or non-interactive scenarios.

trans-unit.source: In these scenarios, you can typically allow more time for the service to recover—with a consequently increased chance of the operation eventually succeeding.
trans-unit.target: In these scenarios, you can typically allow more time for the service to recover—with a consequently increased chance of the operation eventually succeeding.

trans-unit.source: Consider specifying the MaximumExecutionTime property of the RequestOptions parameter to limit the total execution time, but take into account the type and size of the operation when choosing a timeout value.
trans-unit.target: Consider specifying the MaximumExecutionTime property of the RequestOptions parameter to limit the total execution time, but take into account the type and size of the operation when choosing a timeout value.

trans-unit.source: If you need to implement a custom retry, avoid creating wrappers around the storage client classes.
trans-unit.target: If you need to implement a custom retry, avoid creating wrappers around the storage client classes.

trans-unit.source: Instead, use the capabilities to extend the existing policies through the IExtendedRetryPolicy interface.
trans-unit.target: Instead, use the capabilities to extend the existing policies through the IExtendedRetryPolicy interface.

trans-unit.source: If you are using read access geo-redundant storage (RA-GRS) you can use the LocationMode to specify that retry attempts will access the secondary read-only copy of the store should the primary access fail.
trans-unit.target: If you are using read access geo-redundant storage (RA-GRS) you can use the LocationMode to specify that retry attempts will access the secondary read-only copy of the store should the primary access fail.

trans-unit.source: However, when using this option you must ensure that your application can work successfully with data that may be stale if the replication from the primary store has not yet completed.
